title: Tactical steps handle incomplete work gracefully

brief.why: bon step is binary — done or not. Real work has steps that are blocked on external action (manual test, waiting for human) or where the final step shouldn't auto-complete the action. Users hesitate or work around with bon wait, which clears all tactical state.
brief.what: 1. bon step --skip 'reason' — advance past a step without completing it, recording why 2. bon step --no-complete on final step — prevent auto-completing the parent action 3. Skipped steps shown distinctly in bon work --status and bon show
brief.done: Can skip a step with a reason, see it marked as skipped in status output, and prevent final-step auto-complete. 6-step tactical where step 6 is a manual test can be parked without losing steps 1-5 progress.

brief.why: After bon step --no-complete, all steps show ✓ but the action is still open. bon work --status shows checkmarks with no indication this is deliberate. Could be confusing without context.
brief.what: Add a status line to format_tactical output when current >= len(steps) and action is still open, e.g. 'All steps done — action left open (--no-complete)'
brief.done: bon work --status on a no-completed action shows the deliberate-open indicator.

brief.why: cmd_log shows updated events with ~ icon but doesn't say what changed (title edit vs tactical clear vs wait). All mutations look identical in the feed.
brief.what: 1. Add a verb or context field to updated_at tracking (e.g. updated_by_command) 2. Display in cmd_log output (e.g. '~ edited title' vs '~ cleared tactical') 3. Update cmd_show to surface what changed
brief.done: bon log shows distinct verbs for different mutation types. A user can tell what happened without reading items.jsonl.

title: bon doctor command for file health checks

brief.why: No way to validate items.jsonl integrity beyond load-time checks. updated_by verbs aren't validated against a known set. Hand-edits or merge artifacts could introduce invalid state silently.
brief.what: 1. bon doctor command that checks items.jsonl for schema issues 2. Validate updated_by against known verb set (edited, waited, unwaited, worked, stepped, cleared, archived, converted, reopened) 3. Check for orphaned parents, duplicate IDs, missing required fields
brief.done: bon doctor reports issues found or 'all clear'. Invalid updated_by verbs flagged. Orphaned parents flagged.

title: Add updated_by field and display in log/show

brief.why: All mutations set updated_at but not what changed. bon log shows generic ~ updated for everything.
brief.what: 1. Add updated_by field at every mutation site in cli.py (edit, wait, unwait, work, step, clear, archive, convert, reopen) 2. Update cmd_log to use updated_by as the verb 3. Update cmd_show to display updated_by 4. Tests for log output with distinct verbs
brief.done: bon log shows '~ waited', '~ edited', '~ stepped' etc. instead of generic '~ updated'. bon show displays the mutation type.

steps: Add updated_by field at every mutation site in cli.py (edit, wait, unwait, work, step, clear, archive, convert, reopen)
Update cmd_log to use updated_by as the verb
Tests for log output with distinct verbs

title: Cross-repo work doesn't break tactical flow

brief.why: Bon tacticals are CWD-scoped. When work spans two repos (common with bridge code), cd to the other repo silently breaks bon step/show. Users get 'item not found' or see the wrong project's items with no warning.
brief.what: 1. bon step <id> resolves item globally across projects 2. CWD mismatch warning when bon step targets a different project 3. bon work --status shows which CWD/project owns the active tactical
brief.done: Can bon step bb-fiputo from any directory and it finds the right project. Wrong-CWD gets a clear warning. bon work --status shows the owning project path.

title: Add --skip and --no-complete flags to bon step

brief.why: bon step is binary: done or not. Steps blocked on external action (manual test, human review) have no way to advance past them without completing, and final-step auto-complete can't be prevented.
brief.what: 1. Add --skip 'reason' flag to cmd_step — records skip in tactical.skipped dict keyed by step index, advances current 2. Add --no-complete flag to cmd_step — on final step, marks step done but doesn't auto-complete parent action 3. Update format_tactical to show skipped steps with ⊘ marker and reason 4. Update validate_tactical to accept optional skipped dict 5. Tests for skip, no-complete, and display
brief.done: bon step --skip 'reason' advances past current step with ⊘ in output. bon step --no-complete on final step leaves action open. All 5 areas tested.
